Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Teck Resources Limited (NYSE: TE) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, sourced from Yahoo Finance and NYSE):
- **Latest Closing Price**: $44.46
- **Market Capitalization**: $22.67 billion
- **52-Week Range**: $34.38 - $55.13
- **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: 23.81
- **Dividend Yield**: 0.72% (annualized $0.32/share)

## Company Overview (198 words)
Teck Resources Limited is a leading Canadian-based diversified mining company, now transformed into a pure-play growth-focused producer of copper essential for the energy transition. Headquartered in Vancouver, BC, Teck operates world-class assets primarily in copper and zinc, with copper production ramping up significantly following the July 2024 divestiture of its steelmaking coal business to Glencore. Key copper operations include the flagship Quebrada Blanca Phase 2 (QB2) mine in Chile (50% owned by Teck), Highland Valley Copper in British Columbia (100%), and Carmen de Andacollo in Chile (22.5% net interest). Zinc production is led by the Red Dog mine in Alaska (100%), one of the world's largest zinc deposits. Teck emphasizes sustainable mining, with strong ESG commitments including water stewardship and biodiversity. Post-coal spin-off (Elk Valley Resources, July 10, 2024), Teck received ~$7.3B in cash and Glencore shares, bolstering its balance sheet (net cash ~$1.5B as of Q2). The company targets 400-450kt annual copper production by 2024-2027 via QB2 ramp-up, positioning it as a Tier 1 copper producer amid tightening global supply.

## Recent Developments
- **July 10, 2024**: Completed $9B sale of 77% stake in steelmaking coal business (Elk Valley Resources) to Glencore, receiving $6.9B cash + 77.3M Glencore shares (~$430M). Shareholder approval: June 2024.
- **July 25, 2024 (Q2 Earnings)**: Revenue $2.86B (vs. $3.00B prior year); Adjusted EBITDA $703M; Copper production 112kt (+44% YoY); Zinc 162kt (-10% YoY). QB2 ramp-up on track, first copper concentrate shipped March 2024.
- **September 2024**: Announced Zafranal copper project (Peru) construction start Q1 2025, FID expected Q4 2024.
- **October 2024**: Copper prices hit 20-month high (~$4.70/lb) amid supply disruptions (e.g., Cobre Panama closure).
- Ongoing: Legal win vs. BC First Nations on Highland Valley extension (September 2024).

## Growth Strategy
- **Copper-Led Expansion**: Ramp QB2 to 230kt/year design capacity (achieved 70% in Q2); San Nicolás (Mexico, 50/50 w/ BlackRock, 49kt CuEq/year) FID Q1 2025; Zafranal (Peru, 100%, 118kt Cu/year) construction 2025.
- **Exploration**: $100M+ annual budget; key targets: Highland Valley, QC Copper (Chile).
- **Capital Allocation**: $2.5B copper growth capex through 2027; 40-50% FCF returns (dividends/buybacks); net debt target <$2.5B.
- **Sustainability**: Net-zero Scope 1+2 by 2050; 50% GHG cut by 2030.

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company** | QB2 ramp-up exceeding guidance; strong balance sheet post-coal sale; copper C1 cash costs ~$1.90/lb (low quartile). | Initial QB2 ramp-up risks (weather/delays); labor inflation in BC/Chile. |
| **Sector (Copper/Zinc)** | Energy transition demand (EVs, renewables); supply deficits (forecast 500kt by 2025 per S&P Global); Cu prices +25% YTD. | China demand slowdown (60% global Cu use); permitting delays (e.g., US/Peru); energy costs volatility. Zinc oversupply pressures prices (-10% YTD). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Copper**: Concentrates from QB2 (Chile), Highland Valley (Canada), Antamina (Peru, 22.5%).
- **Zinc**: Concentrates/lead from Red Dog (Alaska), Trail smelter (Canada).
- **Byproducts**: Molybdenum, silver, gold, sulfuric acid.
- 2024 Guidance: Copper 340-380kt; Zinc 260-290kt.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Quebrada Blanca Phase 2**: Ramp-up phase (ongoing, full capacity 2028).
- **Zafranal**: Greenfields Cu project, Peru; 24-year life, $1.3B capex.
- **San Nicolás**: Iron-copper, Mexico; shovel-ready, production 2028.
- **Highland Valley Renewal**: Life extension to 2040s (permitting advanced).

## Market Share Approximations and Forecast
- **Current (2024E)**: Global copper ~2.5-3% (Teck ~350kt vs. 22Mt total); Zinc ~5-6% (world #2, ~275kt vs. 13Mt).
- **Forecast**: Copper market share to 4-5% by 2028 (+50-100% production growth via QB2/Zafranal); Zinc stable/decline to 4% as focus shifts. Driven by 20%+ Cu output CAGR 2024-2028 (per company guidance).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (2024E) | Teck (TE) | Freeport (FCX) | Southern Copper (SCCO) | BHP Copper | Rio Tinto Copper |
|----------------|-----------|----------------|-------------------------|------------|------------------|
| **Cu Prod (kt)** | 360 | 1,600 | 530 | 1,250 | 660 |
| **C1 Cash Cost ($/lb)** | 1.90 | 1.50 | 1.80 | 1.70 | 2.10 |
| **EV/EBITDA** | 4.5x | 6.2x | 8.1x | 5.0x | 4.8x |
| **Growth CAGR (Cu 2024-28)** | 20% | 5% | 3% | 4% | 8% |
| **Key Edge** | Growth + low cost | Scale | Byproducts | Diversified | Portfolio |

Teck trades at discount to peers on growth-adjusted multiples; superior Cu growth vs. incumbents.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Sumitomo (QB2 30%); BlackRock (San Nicolás 50%); Glencore (residual coal ties, shareholder).
- **M&A**: Coal divestiture (2024); Acquired NewRange copper (2021, 50/50 w/Rio).
- **Current Major Clients**: Trafigura, Glencore, Mitsubishi (offtake ~50% QB2 production); zinc to Korea Zinc, Nyrstar.
- **Potential Clients**: Expanding QB2 output targets EV battery supply chain (e.g., Tesla, Ford via refiners).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Top-quartile DJSI Metals; TSM 30% tailings standard; biodiversity net gain at 80% sites.
- **Management**: CEO Jonathan Price (since 2023) driving copper pivot; experienced board.
- **Risks**: Geopolitical (Chile/Peru elections 2025); water rights disputes.
- **Upside Catalysts**: Cu >$5/lb; Zafranal FID; FCF yield 10%+ at $4.50 Cu.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **8/10** (Strong Buy for growth portfolios). Rationale: Premium copper assets, 20%+ production growth, copper supercycle tailwinds outweigh zinc weakness/moderate risks. Post-coal purity enhances multiple re-rating (peers 6-8x EV/EBITDA).
- **Fair Value Price Target**: **$58** (30% upside). Based on 6x 2025E EV/EBITDA ($11B, 15% discount to FCX on superior growth); DCF assumes $4.50/lb Cu long-term, 8% IRR hurdle for moderate risk. Hold if Cu <$4/lb.
